mapper.sql: id, `name`, photo_url, first_type_id, second_type_id, `describe`, DATE_FORMAT(`upload_date`, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%s") as upload_date, prise, status_id, user_id, `update`, goods_num, user_name
mapper.insert:

id,
name,
photo_url,
first_type_id,
second_type_id,
describe,
upload_date,
prise,
status_id,
user_id,
update,
goods_num,

mapper.update:
update goods
name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
photo_url = #{photoUrl,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
first_type_id = #{firstTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
second_type_id = #{secondTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
describe = #{describe,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
upload_date = #{uploadDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
prise = #{prise,jdbcType=REAL},
status_id = #{statusId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
update = #{update,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
goods_num = #{goodsNum,jdbcType=INTEGER},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update goods set name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, photo_url = #{photoUrl,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, first_type_id = #{firstTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, second_type_id = #{secondTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, describe = #{describe,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, upload_date = #{uploadDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, prise = #{prise,jdbcType=REAL}, status_id = #{statusId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, update = #{update,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, goods_num = #{goodsNum,jdbcType=INTEGER} where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.select:
select
from goods order by upload_date desc limit 0, 5

select g.`name`, g.photo_url, s.name as second_type_name, g.`describe`, DATE_FORMAT(g.`upload_date`, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%s") as upload_date, g.prise, u.user_name as user_name, g.user_id, g.first_type_id, g.second_type_id, g.id from goods g join user u on g.user_id=u.id join second_type s on g.second_type_id = s.id where g.id=#{goodsId}
select `name`, prise, photo_url, id from goods where second_type_id=#{secondTypeId} order by upload_date desc limit 0,5
select `name`, prise, photo_url, id, status_id, DATE_FORMAT(`upload_date`, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%s") as upload_date from goods where user_id=#{userId}

select id, user_id, name, photo_url, prise, DATE_FORMAT(`upload_date`, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%s") as upload_date, status_id from goods where id in
#{goodsId}

select
from goods where second_type_id=#{secondTypeId} order by upload_date desc

select count(*) from goods
and second_type_id=#{secondTypeId}
and name like '%' #{goodsName} '%'
and status_id=1
mapper.update:
update goods
name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
photo_url = #{photoUrl,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
first_type_id = #{firstTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
second_type_id = #{secondTypeId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
`describe` = #{describe,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
upload_date = #{uploadDate,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
prise = #{prise,jdbcType=REAL},
status_id = #{statusId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
update = #{update,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
goods_num = #{goodsNum,jdbcType=INTEGER},
where id=#{id}
mapper.select: select g.`name`, u.user_name as user_name, s.name as second_type_name, DATE_FORMAT(g.`upload_date`, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%s") as upload_date, g.status_id, g.id from goods g left join second_type s on g.second_type_id=s.id join `user` u on g.user_id=u.id
mapper.update: update goods set status_id=0 where id=#{goodsId}
